A new `NSDate` object set to the current date and time specified by `string`.

This method supports only a limited set of colloquial phrases, primarily in English. It may give unexpected results, and its use is strongly discouraged. # date(withNaturalLanguageString:)

**Type Method**

Creates and returns a date object set to the date and time specified by a given string.

## Declaration

```swift
class func date(withNaturalLanguageString string: String) -> Any?
```

## Parameters

- **string**: A string that contains a colloquial specification of a date, such as “last Tuesday at dinner,” “3pm December 31, 2001,” “12/31/01,” or “31/12/01.”

## Return Value

A new `NSDate` object set to the current date and time specified by `string`.

## Discussion

This method supports only a limited set of colloquial phrases, primarily in English. It may give unexpected results, and its use is strongly discouraged. To create a date object from a string, you should use a date formatter object instead (see [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/DateFormatter] and [https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/Cocoa/Conceptual/DataFormatting/DataFormatting.html#//apple_ref/doc/uid/10000029i]).

In parsing the string, this method uses the date and time preferences stored in the user’s defaults database. (See [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDate/date(withNaturalLanguageString:locale:)] for a list of the specific items used.)

## Legacy Operations

- **date(withNaturalLanguageString:locale:)**: Creates and returns a date object set to the date and time specified by a given string.
- **date(with:)**: Creates and returns a date object with a date and time value specified by a given string in the international string representation format (`YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS ±HHMM`).
- **init(string:)**: Returns a date object initialized with a date and time value specified by a given string in the international string representation format.
- **addTimeInterval(_:)**: Returns a new date object that is set to a given number of seconds relative to the receiver.
- **date(withCalendarFormat:timeZone:)**: Converts the receiver to a calendar date with a given format string and time zone.
- **description(withCalendarFormat:timeZone:locale:)**: Returns a string representation of the date formatted as specified by given conversion specifiers.
